duties_responsibilities.duty: Gather statistics and general data; review and combine this information into established reports for use internally.
May be responsible for verifying data gathered, such as matching supplier invoices against file copies.
Receive direction from immediate supervisor in completing non-routine assignments.
Scan, fax and bind documents, reports, and proposals as required.
May develop new or revise existing reports and SharePoint presentations, as directed.
Distribute reports as directed by immediate supervisor.
Prepare general correspondence and maintain general files.
Maintain a project-wide Calendar and schedule meetings as needed.
Answer telephone, take and relay messages, screen callers and direct calls accordingly.
Maintain an organized work space by keeping documents and supplies properly stored.
May establish and maintain records of equipment, including a log of equipment service dates. May initiate requests for service.
Maintain an organized work space by keeping documents and supplies properly stored.
Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.
May represent immediate supervisor at project-related or other meetings as directed.
Must be a proactive team player who shares routine office duties with members of the Office Administrative team.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma. Certifications for document control professionals highly desirable. Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field (Master's preferred)
